str2: The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A tomb, sepulcher, monument. From mneme; a remembrance, i.e. Cenotaph.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Passive - 3rd Person Plural
str2: To open. From ana and oigo; to open up.
Body, flesh; the body of the Church. From sozo; the body, used in a very wide application, literally or figuratively.
Set apart by (or for) God, holy, sacred. From hagos; sacred.

parse: Verb - Perfect Participle Middle or Passive - Genitive Masculine Plural
str2: From keimai; to put to sleep, i.e. to slumber; figuratively, to decease.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Passive - 3rd Person Plural
str2: (a) I wake, arouse, (b) I raise up. Probably akin to the base of agora; to waken, i.e. Rouse.
